key_responsibilities: lead the Representative’s legislative work and manage a team of Legislative Assistants and Fellows
work with the Chief of Staff, Member, and other senior team members to develop a legislative strategy and priorities

train and supervise the legislative team members, review/approve work from other legislative team members, track legislative accomplishments and statistics, provide vote recommendations, and develop and advance legislative proposals from initial idea to final passage
work closely with the District team to ensure that the team’s legislative focus aligns with District priorities and legislative ideas are coming from District issues and casework
manage his/her own portfolio of legislative work
requirements: several years of Hill experience, preferably in the House and ideally in more than one office

strong writing and analytical skills, a substantial policy background, attention to detail, facility at managing multiple competing tasks, and the ability to operate with grace and humor in a fast-paced environment

key_responsibilities: drafting and advancing legislative proposals
preparing the Member for hearings and markups

providing vote recommendations

office: House Democratic Policy and Communications Committee (DPCC)

assist with daily tasks and long-term planning as needed

experience planning meetings and events
organized
politically astute
able to collaborate with others in a tight-knit, fast-paced environment
familiarity with the House and an understanding of the priorities and values of the House Democratic Caucus
previous experience interacting with elected officials

key_responsibilities: writing press releases, op-eds, franked mail
managing social media and the official website

strong writer

ability to manage multiple tasks

key_responsibilities: serve as the spokesperson and primary communications advisor to the Member
responsible for developing and executing an aggressive strategic communications plan, including social media, that encompasses local, national, and specialty media outlets

oversee day-to-day press operations including responding to media inquiries, booking the Member for interviews, pitching news opportunities to media outlets, updating and maintaining the Member’s social media accounts, and producing speeches, talking points, floor statements, press releases, op-eds and e-newsletters
managing a Press Secretary and working with the Member, Chief of Staff, Legislative Director, and District Director to develop and coordinate core messaging

highly organized
proficient in multi-tasking
strong political acumen and instincts
superior writing, editing, and proof-reading skills
willing to work extended hours and oftentimes under time constraints, while maintaining a positive demeanor and sense of humor

congressional and/or campaign experience

digital media and newsroom experience

office: Office of the Law Revision Counsel
key_responsibilities: reading new laws to determine which provisions should appear in the Code and where
updating the Code to reflect new law and amendments to existing law
writing concise editorial notes to explain amendments, effective dates, references within the text to other laws, and a variety of other legislative concepts
preparing statutory citations and tables
identifying errors in grammar and spelling
reviewing drafts of bills to enact titles as positive law
doing extensive research and editorial work to improve the organization of existing provisions in the Code
assisting in the continuing modernization of the Office, including support of online and machine readable versions of the Code
requirements: J.D. degree and attorney license in any U.S. jurisdiction or intention to obtain license within one year
at least one year of professional experience in editing or publishing, preferably in the legal field
meticulous attention to detail and dedication to accuracy
excellent verbal and written communication skills
absolute proficiency in grammar, spelling, and usage
ability to analyze and summarize complex legal issues
ability to identify issues affecting Federal statutes and explain them clearly and concisely within firmly established parameters
